availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis W. Potter (Warren county, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Warren county, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Rebecca Hays Potter in Warren County, Kentucky, on March 16, 1837. Father of John T. Potter, Elizabeth F. Potter, Martha A. Potter, Rebecca S. Potter, Joseph Potter, and Samuel Potter. Farmer in Warren County in 1850. Farmer in Warren County in 1860. Nominated sheriff of Warren County by the provisional government of Kentucky in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren, District 2, p. 66B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren, District 1, p. 740.
Find A Grave, "Lewis W. Potter (1816-1897)," Memorial #112798548, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/112798548 (accessed December 21, 2019).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film #000339890.
KYR-0004-033-0017.
